intro: Schrankia quadrivalvis, commonly known as the four-valved schrankia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive four-lobed calyx, which gives it its common name. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and are borne on slender stalks. Schrankia quadrivalvis is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
